abstract.t: DKIM (RFC 6376, section 3.7) defines how "data-hash" is generated as input to a RSA (RFC 8017) "sig-alg". Modern signature algorithms (for example EdDSA, RFC 8032) include extensive data hashing as part of the signing process. This memo allows DKIM signing algorithm "data-hash" adaptivity, taking advantage of algorithm progress and digital signature API reality.
